name: Critical Reading and Writing in English Linguistics
description: The goal of the course is to develop skill in academic writing through the analysis of representative articles concerning classic and current issues in English linguistics. Careful reading and discussion will lead students to construct concise summaries of the texts and to critically evaluate them using cohesive, logical arguments. [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: LIN101H5, LIN102H5, LIN205H5, plus 0.5 credit at the 200-level in LIN.
